property.name: text
property.value: If the light goes green, then in the next step there should be no car. This delay ensures that.

property.name: text
property.value: This model composes two FSMs synchronously. The CarGenerator nondeterministically may make a car appear if the input is absent. The Traffic light moves to green if a car is present, then yellow, then red. The Animator simply animates the result. Open the actors to see how they are implemented.

property.name: text
property.value: If you remove the NonStrictDelay, and close the feedback loop again, no car will ever appear. Why? See the text.

property.name: text
property.value: The syntax for transitions is not exactly the same in Ptolemy II as in the text (there are good reasons for this). Consequently, in this diagram, on each transition, the first line of the annotation shows the syntax used in the text. The remaining lines give the Ptolemy II syntax.

property.name: text
property.value: In the noCar state, if the input is absent, then nondeterministically choose between stuttering or making a car appear and transitioning to the car state. In the car state, if the input is present, then transition back to the noCar state.

property.name: text
property.value: The syntax for transitions is not exactly the same in Ptolemy II as in the text (there are good reasons for this). Consequently, in this diagram, on each transition, the first line of the annotation shows the syntax used in the text. The remaining lines give the Ptolemy II syntax.

property.name: text
property.value:
Remain in the red state until a car appears. When that happens, change the light to green and transition to the green state.
Here, we assume that the timeR, timeY, and timeY inputs referenced in the text are always present. Consequently, this state machine will be in the green and yellow states only for exactly one tick, and the transition from red to green will happen in the same tick that a car appears.

property.name: text
property.value: This model sets the value of four variables to true if the corresponding input port is present and to false otherwise. The resulting values are used by the icon of this actor to animate the execution of the traffic light example.
